title.narrative: Ecosystem Management: Building Resilience and Adaptability to Coastal Climate Change Effects

description.narrative:
EMBRACE will provide a solid foundation for a future Network Plus GCRF grant, and provide important baseline information within South Africa, delivered through two interrelated work packages. The work packages focus on three objectives:
1. Review current South African climate resilience legislation and estuarine policies, including implementation of the current estuarine health index for estuary management, and evaluate these policies for future climate resilience, with a focus on water quality.
2. Conduct three case studies (one each: urban; peri-urban; rural) into the local contextual complexities of using the estuarine management plan; identify challenges (environmental, political, social, economic) that need to be addressed to strengthen resilience.
3. Use the identified case studies to produce recommendations for improving climate resilience, and guidelines on how these case estuaries can be used as a national template for 'future-proofing' estuarine ecosystems.
Ecosystem Management: Building Resilience and Adaptability to Coastal Climate Change Effects
